diff_hunk:
@@ -54,4 +54,16 @@
       end
     end
   end
+
+  describe 'POST create' do
+    context 'unauthenticated users' do
+      let(:params) { { name: 'name', country: 'country', region: 'region', location: 'location', city: 'city', season_id:'1', url: 'www.conference.com' } }
body:
What's the point in assigning this huge params hash if you in the end only want to test whether or not a user is signed in? I'd suggest to shorten it to:
```ruby
it "does not create a new conference record" do
  expect { post :create, params: conference: {} }.not_to change { Conference.count }
end
```
